headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: Former Atty: Mar-A-Lago I.T. Worker Strikes Cooperation Agreement With Special Counsel, Has Agreed To Testify; Judge: Trial For Chesebro & Powell To Begin Oct. 23; Prison Official: Murderer Climbed Onto Roof To Escape. Aired 3-3:30p ET

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Very quickly, this is the nightmare for Trump that some of his co-defendants will flip, begin to cooperate against him.

utterances.speaker: PAULA REID, CNN SENIOR LEGAL AFFAIRS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Of course, and to Dana's point, I've learned that after what happened with Michael Cohen, of course he flipped very publicly on the former president. The former president has been much more careful about trying to keep people in the fold, and there are some questions about some of his advisors, why they're still around.But I've been told, people close to him and even the former president, they acknowledge that, yes, it's important right now to keep these people in the fold, to the extent possible help with their legal fees to an extent, we know there are limits on his generosity there, but he definitely learned lessons from Michael Cohen and I'm sure he is not pleased that Mr. Taveras is cooperating. But again, he is not necessarily in the same league as someone like Boris Epshteyn or Michael Cohen was at one time, but this is not good news for him.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: All right. Everybody stand by, we have a lot more news we're following right now.

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN CHIEF WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to our special live coverage of the first televised hearing in the Trump election subversion case in the state of Georgia. I'm Kaitlan Collins in New York alongside Wolf Blitzer in Washington.And this afternoon we witnessed history in real time and on camera, as you could see inside the courtroom, the arguments and the key rulings from the judge overseeing this case. The core issue that remains, of course, is whether Donald Trump and 18 of his co-defendants will be ultimately tried together in a sweeping RICO indictment or if the case will splinter off into several trials. We now know at least two defendants will stand trial together next month. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JUDGE SCOTT MCAFEE, FULTON COUNTY SUPERIOR COURT
utterances.sentences: Based on what's been presented today, I'm not finding the severance from Mr. Chesebro or Powell is necessary to achieve a fair determination of the guilt or innocence for either defendant in this case. And so I'll deny Mr. Chesebro's motions to sever from Ms. Powell. I'll deny in part Ms. Powell's motion to sever from Mr. Chesebro and the plan will be to enter a scheduling order for Ms. Powell mirroring that Mr. Chesebro with the October 23rd date holding.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: That was the ruling from Judge Scott McAfee when pro-Trump lawyer Kenneth Chesebro and former Trump campaign lawyer Sidney Powell will stand trial now on October 23rd. The question, of course, is will any additional defendants be standing next to them? The judge said he was "very skeptical of the state's request to hold one sweeping trial for all 19 of the co-defendants."CNN's Nick Valencia is live outside the courthouse in Georgia. Nick, you were inside that room for this hearing and what was also notable is that there were other attorneys for people who were not there trying to get their cases severed today. Jeffrey Clark, Rudy Giuliani, other attorneys in the room. What did you all see?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: It certainly seems that way.Nick Valencia, thank you. Wolf, back to you.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: Happening now, state police in Pennsylvania are giving an update right now on the search for the escaped inmate, Danelo Cavalcante. Let's listen in.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Lieutenant Colonel, do you think he has more ability to hide from you than you thought he did when this thing started since it's seven days now?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: No, I don't think he has any more ability than we initially gave him credit for. I think that it's a very challenging area. I think we've had a number of these types of searches in the past. Some take hours, some take days, some take weeks and some take months. We're committed to the search, and we will find him. We will bring him back into the criminal justice system.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: A question for the DA or the Acting Warden, you guys had access to this video, you saw this. Why did it take so long to alert the public on how he escaped?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: You said it's for the warden?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: DA or the Acting Warden.

utterances.speaker: DEB RYAN, CHESTER COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Well, I can address that. That matter was referred to the attorney general's office immediately. We are engaged in a thorough investigation.As I've stated before, our main focus is bringing this man into custody. We were putting all of our efforts to try to locate him. There was a simultaneous investigation into the prison escape and today was the day that we believed we needed to bring in the Acting Warden to address the public about how he escaped.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What you do as the attorney general ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What you do ahead of that is that you want to release that information to the public?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is the Attorney General's investigation supplanting the Chester County detectives' investigation?

utterances.speaker: RYAN
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: How was that possible (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) person was able to take the same escape route as someone just months previous and really nothing was done to prevent that? Obviously, someone didn't do their job in instituting (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So as I said earlier, according to the document, we did have a consulting firm come out to identify how that individual escaped and we thought we took appropriate measures to present that - prevent that with the razor wire. Again, the one thing we didn't take into account was a failure on the human element side. We only focused on the physical infrastructure and not necessarily human element.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So was the (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So did the guards failed (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Was there no one in the tower? Is that why you didn't get the call or was he asleep?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: Someone was in the tower at the time.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So he'd seen - should have seen this and did the person in the tower have seen him leave?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: The position of the towers are for observation posts, which overlook the yards.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: Just one at a time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) I'm hearing from state police, local law enforcement and marshals that you guys have multiple channels. Last night I witnessed it, there was an officer from Kennett Square. There was activity. That officer didn't hear anything. He asked the trooper, what's going on. They said we're on a different channel. He was left in the dark. I'm hearing now from - there was least 12 officers in the past six days that told me they are not able to communicate in concert with you guys. Are there multiple channels that you guys are operating?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Has he obtained a weapon? And if so, what kind of weapon do you think he has?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: We have not determined that he has obtained a weapon.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: When was the consultant brought in and what was the name of the consultant (inaudible)?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So I don't have the exact date nor name of the consulting firm.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: I can get that for you. Because I ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Lt. Col. Bivens, is any infrared or heat-seeking device used to track him at least at night?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: There are a number of types of technology. I think it's certainly reasonable to believe something like that would be included in the array of technology that we would bring to bear.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Hold on, hold on, hold on, in the Igor Bolte case, the inmates were distracting the guard. There was a fight on the basketball court is what the criminal complaint says. In this case, too, we had heard that there was also some sort of group of inmates or a line of inmates on that yard. Is that obstructing or is it just that the inmates also figured out how to do this as well? So what is being taken to address that concern, that you have an inmate standing there in that video? Is that guy a lookout? Are they all talking about how to do this? What are you doing there on the human side with the inmates to make sure nobody tries this again?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So as I said for the investigation of how or why this occurred, including the investigation and questioning of the inmates that were there, that's done by the Attorney General's office, so I don't have the exact answer.Moreover, as we've developed information into this, we are certainly going to look at what the actions of that tower officer were, why he didn't observe what was occurring in that yard. I'm not sure as to how or why. He wasn't - didn't address it at this point. (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) why not share that video early on if you knew how he escaped?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's the question that everyone had.

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: Again, as part of the investigation ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you step up a little bit?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: Certainly. I'm sorry. As part of the investigation, that would have been up to the Attorney General's office to release that and when it was to be released. At this point, we thought it was prudent and had permission to release it.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is the tower officer on duty or is he suspended? Is he still working?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: He is on administrative leave.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This is for the district attorney or the warden. Can you confirm or deny that the escapee had a map of the area that was hand-drawn detailing the route from the prison to the Chester County courthouse? Is that anything worth (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: RYAN
utterances.sentences: No, I have no evidence to suggest that he had a map of the area.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: How about the warden (inaudible) ... HOLLAND

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: This individual was listed as an escape risk. This was known that he was looking to do something like this prior, why was he - and also he's here on a murder charge. He's being held here waiting for - to be sent to state prison. We know he's wanted in Brazil. Why is he roaming around the yard like this and not in a more secure location? And is that something you'll do as the administrator of the prison later to reevaluate how high-risk offenders have free access around the prison?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So to answer your question, we will certainly reevaluate how we're handling inmates of that level, especially murder suspects, but we also have to understand that these individuals have certain rights. So it's not a question of will we let him out again, it's certainly a question of would I put him back out there with a group of other individuals or would it be a one-on-one and it would be a one-on-one from this point on.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you believe that Brandywine Creek is a possible escape route? Do you believe the Brandywine Creek is a possible escape route? Officers are monitoring it on Route 1.

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I would say that we are open to anything being a possibility as far as an escape route and we're actively working to keep that area secure. I wouldn't comment on the viability of one versus another escape route.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you think he's out of your perimeter?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I do not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you think he's slipped your perimeter?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I do not.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What makes you believe that?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: Everything that I'm able to see, the various sightings that we've had, other aspects of this investigation lead me to believe that he is still there in that area.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you describe the boundaries in that perimeter that you believe he's (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: Sure. So on the northern end, Route 921, on the east ...

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry, 926. On the eastern side, 100 or Creek Road. On the southern side, Hillendale and on the western side, 52.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: How big is this compared to what your perimeter was in the days past?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Cavalcante was in custody since 2021. He would have been in jail the same time as Igor Bolte, is there any indication that the two of them had any contact?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: We have no information at this time connecting that. But, again, that is not up for me to determine. It's up for the Attorney General's Office and the investigation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) chosen to share this information today, have these similarities between Igor Bolte's release not been made public?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry, one more time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Would you have chosen to share the details of Cavalcante's escape and the similarities to Igor's had the information not come to light yesterday?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So I don't really think it's a decision of me releasing. I think it was appropriate with the coordination of the Attorney General's Office to release it when they deemed appropriate, so that's why we're here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Lieutenant Colonel, is the legal force authorized only in the perimeter or is it authorized statewide in the next state if he does not surrender, clearly, to ...

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I have no authority in the next state. I have authority in Pennsylvania - with the Pennsylvania State Police.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is it statewide, the legal force, if he's seen anywhere in the state or is it around ...

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: No, the directive pertains to this particular search.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And the backpack or the sighting today, that was reported, I believe by Fox 29, where he might have been getting into a green - a dark green car. Does that come to any fruition or is that ... BIVENS

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There was a dispatch this morning that said that an individual with a backpack matched the description of the escapee and gotten into a dark green car.

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: No, that was not related to this.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Warden Holland, is the photo of Mr. Cavalcante that we see here, was that taken just before the escape?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: I believe it was. Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Are you getting a lot of sightings throughout the region outside the perimeter, other parts of Chester County - other counties where people are thinking that they're seeing him and what kind of stress did that put on your resources?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: We are not getting a lot of sightings outside of the perimeter, in fact, very few. They are being fully investigated. Nothing has led me to believe that any of them were actually him. And we have the ability to do this operation and follow up outside of the area as well.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Any idea where he thinks he might be trying to get to?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I do have some ideas of where he thinks he might be trying to get to, but I'm not prepared to discuss that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: What about his family?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) in the area?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You said last week he's trying to head - you think he's trying to head south, maybe to Mexico or Brazil. Do you still believe that?

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: I believe he's trying to head south. In terms of his final destination, again, I'm not prepared to discuss that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Are family members cooperating or has it been determined that they may have been aided (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: BIVENS
utterances.sentences: We're not going to discuss any parts of the investigation involving the family.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I just wanted to ask about the - if you could take me back to the escape - could you give an approximate width from one wall to the next?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So I would say approximately maybe five feet, maybe less. UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Does that - what does that mean? (Inaudible) already, can you explain (inaudible) ...

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So the yards are block wall with an exterior fence with an open top. Along that line are razor wires so someone physically can't climb the fence. Moreover, there's a smaller mesh fence on the second half, so the fence is probably 10 to 15 feet high.What the proposal is, is actually to cap that whole thing in basically as a cage so no one can physically climb out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: All the way from the fence to the building?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: All the way and all eight yards that we have.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are you reviewing any other video that shows him practicing this? I mean, did he just boldly do this on a whim, figuring out that he could grab (inaudible) this wall?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So we have no supportive evidence as far as video that shows him trying to do this, no other information of him attempting it from any other inmate.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Which yard is this

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So this is C yard.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You talked about the control tower and there being a guard in there that did not observe the escape. Is there any corrections officer that is physically present with the inmates when they're in that recreation area? And if not, why not?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So there's physically no correctional officer in with the inmates. For the observation tower, is to observe the inmates, one, obviously for any type of injury, any type of fight that's gone away and any escape attempt.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Why wouldn't there be someone just outside there not inside?

utterances.speaker: HOLLAND
utterances.sentences: So typically the other thing we have is a video monitor in that area. So we don't put two staff in there as part of the upgraded system that we're putting in. We are ...

utterances.speaker: DANNY FREEMAN, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: That's right, Wolf.Listen, CNN reported earlier this morning that this prisoner, Danelo Cavalcante, was able to climb up onto the roof and that was how he escaped, a law enforcement - a source told me that earlier. But, Wolf, I mean, we all just watched that video. I don't think anyone expected it to look as stunning as it just did. Danelo Cavalcante crab-walking, putting his hands up against one part of the wall, his legs up against the other, and basically shimmying up that wall to the top of the roof. And, Wolf, what's incredibly interesting about this is the prison warden says when he got up there, there is still razor wire on top of that roof, and Cavalcante basically just blasted through that razor wire and ultimately escaped. Now, Wolf, I really want to drill down on this because this is a very important point. To understand this moment that happened seven days ago at this prison behind me, you actually have to go back four months. Because four months ago, in May, another inmate at this prison behind me escaped from the Chester County prison the exact same way. And I want to actually read from the affidavit that we got our hands- on, CNN obtained just a few hours ago. Let me ask you if it sounds familiar, the defendant said he was a rock climber and he was able to climb the wall in the narrow area by putting his legs on one wall and his arms on another wall, and from there, he was able to scale the wall to the roof and pulled himself onto the roof of that prison. Wolf, that is an affidavit four months old. Now, the prison says that they put in security measures to prevent that from happening. They added that razor wire, but again, clearly seven days ago, that razor wire was not enough. And I should note of that particular inmate, he was captured about five minutes after he got off of the prison roof and started running towards the town, but Cavalcante now has been on the loose for seven days. And another thing that we learned is that there was a bit of an hour - about an hour delay in actually realizing that Cavalcante had escaped, and that is perhaps why this issue has escalated the way that it has. Now, Wolf, one of the other, I should say, things that we've learned today is that this search area has largely expanded instead of being towards the south, where one of the more prominent sightings was on Monday evening, we're now looking towards the east of the prison, kind of the southeast area. And the lieutenant colonel from the Pennsylvania State Police, you just heard right there, Lt. Col. George Bivens, he says, still emphatically at this point, he believes that Cavalcante is in the area. He said there was a sighting not too far from where we are right here, but again, to our southeast last night. But again, the manhunt still very much underway and that stunning video, Wolf, I think surprised a lot of folks seven days after the escape.

utterances.speaker: BLITZER
utterances.sentences: Truly stunning video indeed.Danny Freeman, stand by, we'll get back to you. I want to bring in CNN Law Enforcement Analyst, Jonathan Wackrow, right now. Jonathan, what do you make of this amazing video showing how this murderer actually escaped?
